authorities.label: Signing authority on the Haberdasher Labs Tree multisig

node.name: Hats protoDAO
node.description:
This hat is worn by the protoDAO itself, via [Hats protoDAO's moloch v3 interface](https://admin.daohaus.fun/#/molochv3/0xa/0xcf4b2e60273da3718fd16ee0d4cb176247ecc28a). 

Hats protoDAO exists to 1) create and steward the best possible organizational primitive for roles (Hats), and 2) explore and curate the vast design space of how to use the protocol to solve real problems. 

It does this by: 
- establishing valuable connections between members of the ecosystem, 
- developing net new functionality for the ecosystem around the protocol, and 
- governing the commons. 

As a protoDAO that is not yet a true DAO, it aims to set the foundations of a strong network and effective mechanisms that will serve as the catalysts and basis for a world-class DAO that can govern the Hats Protocol commons for decades to come.

authorities.label: Collectively determine how to fulfill responsibilities
authorities.description: Make decisions on potential actions relating to its responsibilities

authorities.label: Execute protoDAO proposals
Curate the Hats Ecosystem content
authorities.description: Content includes: Hats Awesome list, would-be-awesome list, content, and meeting agendas

authorities.description: Coordination platforms include: the Hats Community Charmverse, Wiki, and Forum

authorities.label: Create specific hats to empower Steward contributions
authorities.description: Create hats that grant Stewards the requisite authorities to accomplish their desired contributions

authorities.label: Endorse and publish Hats Ecosystem Data Standards

authorities.label: Maintain the Hats Modules Registry curation mechanism

authorities.label: Curate the Hats Modules Registry
Endorse and publish official Hats events

node.name: Hats Community Admin
node.description: This hat is to be worn only by Hatter contracts to facilitate minting and/or claiming of its child hats

authorities.label: Enable claiming for the Community Member hat
Enable claiming for the Contributor hat

node.name: Hats Community Member
node.description:
The Hats Community Member Hat signifies participation in the Hats Community, and gives the wearer access to the Hats Protocol Charmverse space and the Hats Community Telegram channel.

[Claim the Community Member Hat here](https://hatsprotocol.deform.cc/community) with agreement of the [Hats Community Agreements and Code of Conduct](https://app.charmverse.io/hats-protocol/page-5790577709721176)

authorities.label: Access to the Hats Community Telegram group
authorities.description: Read & write access in the Hats Community Telegram group

authorities.label: Read access on the Hats Protocol Charmverse
Access to the Hats Protocol Forum
authorities.description: For more information about the forum, see this post: https://forum.hatsprotocol.xyz/t/welcome-to-hats-protocol-community-forum/

authorities.label: Access to Hats Town Hall and Deep Dive meetings
authorities.description: These typically happen on Zoom and are published on a shared Hats Protocol Ecosystem calendar and announced in the community telegram

node.name: Hats Contributor
node.description: Contributors are all those making meaningful contributions to the development of the Hats Protocol ecosystem.

node.name: Hats Steward
node.description:
Stewards collectively govern the shared resources of Hats protoDAO (such as those listed in the Authorities section below), support the progressive decentralization of the project, and advance the adoption and growth of the Hats Protocol ecosystem.

For more details on this role, [see this link](https://app.charmverse.io/hats-protocol/page-6153647704903524)

node.name: Hats Alpha Tester
node.description: This hat is reserved to provide Hats alpha testers with early access to workspaces or content where feedback is requested

node.name: Hats protoDAO Role Admin
node.description: This hat is reserved for hatter contracts required to enable role staking and claiming for specific protoDAO roles

node.name: Hats Community Coordinator
node.description: Community Coordinators support the growth of the Hats Community by overseeing, making recommendations on, and proposing the granting and revocation of Community Member and Contributor hats

authorities.label: Read access for Community form submissions
authorities.description: Read access for Contributor Submission database and Community hat-wearer form submissions

node.name: Hats Arbitrator
node.description: Hats protoDAO Arbitrators support the healthy evolution of the protoDAO by helping to address code of conduct violation submissions and navigate conflicts with an eye towards reaching resolutions that uphold the community's values and that reach towards a restorative approach rather than a punitive one as much as possible.

authorities.label: Vote on dispute proposals
authorities.description: Vote on proposals related to relevant disputes to which the arbitrator has been selected

node.name: protoDAO Coordinator
node.description:
The protoDAO Coordinator is responsible for coordinating all aspects of the protoDAO, cultivating a strong network and effective mechanisms that will serve as the catalysts and basis for a world-class DAO that can govern the Hats Protocol commons for decades to come.

The responsibilities below are currently pinned onto the protoDAO Coordinator hat, but they could be decentralized over time and spin out into separate hats.

authorities.label: Lead design and facilitation for protoDAO calls and convenings
Admin access in protoDAO systems
authorities.description: Admin authorities for protoDAO communication channels, workspaces, and tools, including Telegram, Charmverse, Snapshot, Coordinape, Zoom, and Google Workspaces

node.name: Modules Registry Curator
node.description: The role of the Modules Registry Curator is to ensure a high standard of quality and usability for modules within the Hats Ecosystem. They do so by reviewing and approving submissions and modifications to the Hats Modules Registry in accordance with the curation guidelines and in collaboration with fellow Curators and the protoDAO at large.

authorities.label: Approve module submission PRs
authorities.description: Approve module submission PRs in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Merge PRs when approved by 2 or more Curators

node.name: Module Curation Manager
node.description: The role of the Modules Registry Manager is to foster a healthy ecosystem of Hats Modules. They do so by governing the Hats Modules Registry mechanisms in collaboration with other Managers and the protoDAO at large.

authorities.label: Approve PRs to the submission schema
authorities.description: Approve PRs to change the submission schema in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Approve PRs to the curation cadence
authorities.description: Approve PRs to change the curation cadence in the modules-registry repository.

authorities.label: Merge PRs when approved by 2 or more Managers

node.name: Role Curator
node.description: Stewards who want to step into a higher level of engagement will be invited to stake protoVOTES to claim the Role Curator hat, which will give them the power to permissionlessly create a specific role for themselves via a hat for the season.

node.name: Hats Memeologist
node.description: Responsible for the generation, curation and engagement of Hats memes.

node.name: Podcastoooor üéôÔ∏è
node.description: Manage and/or participate in the production of the Hats Podcast

node.name: protoDAO Evolution Catalyst
node.description:
High context coordination and co-channeling with Haberdasher Labs and other Stewards on the continued discovery, development, and evolution of what the ProtoDAO ought to be, with the primary output being co-authorship of seasonal proposals to continuously advance operational capability, strategic clarity, and developmental capacity of the organization.

Anticipated length of term through the end of 2025, though by its very nature this role will evolve substantially leading up to and beyond that point in time.

node.name: Hats in Practice
node.description: Show the value and use of Hats, a governance protocol. Many appreciate Hats but don't know its benefits for DAOs or organizations. Real-life use cases and stories will demonstrate Hats' value, helping more people understand and use it.

node.name: Legal Engineer ‚öîÔ∏è‚öñÔ∏èüõ°Ô∏è
node.description:
1. Increase Hats adoption by deploying Hats as a law firm for clients who need to control digital assets; use Hats as a latency-deterministic abstraction for cryptographic signatures that are code-deference integrated with latency-discretionary legal agreements.

2. Strengthen the Hats builder ecosystem by continuing to create 'interdata' modules that integrate Hats into legal solution stacks, including the development of a Hats, Snapshot, Gitcoin Passport and Unlock Protocol operating system.

3. Evolve and coordinate the protoDAO by discussing how the protoDAO can be duplicated as a public good governance system, how the protoDAO can evolve its legal structure and how the protoDAO can harness 'the entropic state' for simple-made-easy extitutional entanglements.

node.name: Capellophile
node.description: This hats purpose is to helps Increase Hats adoption with orgs, people and developers through content that leads to adoption

node.name: Systems Facilitator üï∏Ô∏è
node.description: Responsible for stewarding Hats protoDAO's evolution and unfoldment into a deliberately developmental organization through the design and facilitation of marquee convenings, peer coaching and mutual support protocols, office hours and biweekly Stewards+ meetings.

authorities.label: Ability to add events to the Hats Steward's Google Calendar
Design and facilitation of Stewards meetings

node.name: Farcaster Mechanic
node.description:
The Mechanic(s) help activate the community in the /hatsprotocol channel on Farcaster to increase hats adoption there by engaging and growing the community through experiments that directly use Hats features and selective ProtoRep emissions all while ensuring controlled and valuable token emissions in collaboration with other stewards and the Haberdasher team for any experiments conducted.

The role will be evaluated at the end of S3 and may continue beyond.

authorities.label: Farcaster Channel Permissions (TBD)
authorities.description: Ability for FC Mechanic hat wearers to manage channel settings (may require a hatsGated FID setup)

node.name: Hats Game Design Project Manager
node.description:
The goal of this role is to drive the design of engaging, promotional games that promote the power of Hats, help spread awareness of the DAO and protocol, and ultimately increase Hats adoption.

While there will be specific milestones completed by the end of Season 3, this initiative, if successful, will span multiple seasons or even years. The ultimate goal is to build in a way that anyone can pick up the ball and run with it.

node.name: Integration Sleuth
node.description: The Integration Sleuth role is focused on discovering and enabling Hats integration for application and tools developers. This top-level Hat exists on a season-over-season basis and it will evolve with the Integration Sleuth role itself. Its child Hats represent the season-specifc outcomes and deliverables.

node.name: Integration Sleuth S3
node.description: This hat encapsulates the Integration Sleuth work, outcomes, and deliverables over the course of Season 3.

node.name: CEO
node.description:
Haberdasher Labs is temporarily transitioning into a structure with a single hierarchical leader for the purpose of and during the time of fundraising.

This role is held accountable to [established agreements and intentions](https://app.charmverse.io/haberdasherlabs/ceo-952399732884559) both by the Haberdashers and by a majority of current team members.

authorities.label: Solely direct team resources
authorities.description:
Solely direct the resources of the team toward the complicated goal of fundraising over a constrained time period:
- Time and attention
- Communications
- Support from broader network

node.name: Ecosystem
node.description: https://app.charmverse.io/haberdasherlabs/page-2266508852572231

node.name: Ecosystem Lead
node.description:
- The Ecosystem Lead role is focused on cultivating a highly engaged ecosystem of contributors (including community members, active contributors, and stewards) in order to create and steward the best possible organizational primitive and solution-set for roles (Hats). This will involve catalyzing the Hats ecosystem to explore and curate the vast design space of ways of using that primitive to solve real problems, and to develop sticky network effects associated with the canonical version of the protocol.
- The primary metrics for success of this role are¬†
  - number and growth rate of contributor + steward hat wearers (as combined they are a reflection of all the folks who are actively contributing to the protoDAO) with a growth rate target of 40% from Seasons 1 to 2, as well as¬†
  - number and growth rate of community hat wearers (a reflection of the size of the reach/periphery of the protoDAO) with a growth rate target of 100% from Seasons 0 to 1 and 1 to 2.¬†

node.name: Technology Lead
node.description:
- The Technology Lead role is focused on stewarding the Hats Protocol technology stack as well as the team(s) contributing to its development. It holds the ‚Äúwhole‚Äù of the tech stack and is concerned with its security, quality, capture-resistance, and strategic value.
- Success for this role is measured by a subjective / fuzzy combination of problem-technology fit trajectory and building velocity, mediated by decentralization trajectory and security, for the Hats Protocol technology stack.

- Success for this role is measured by a subjective assessment of how well the protocol continues to meet the needs of its stakeholders over time.

node.name: Marketing Lead
node.description:
The Marketing Lead role is focused on increasing awareness of Hats among our target audiences, and getting qualified prospects (those who have good fit and readiness to use or build on Hats) into the Hats funnel. 

The primary metrics for success of this role are: 
1. number of qualified prospect users in our funnel, as tracked in 3RM and
2. number of qualified prospect builders in our funnel, as tracked in 3RM

High-value technical partnerships lead to key integrations and compositions that significantly expand the Hats Protocol value proposition to wearers and/or builders.
